Description:
Adversaries may use port monitors to run an attacker supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation.
A port monitor can be set through the AddMonitor API call to set a DLL to be loaded at startup.


Author: frack113
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Add Port Monitor Persistence in Registry
Query: sourcetype like 'windows-%' eql select * from _source_ where ((target_object like '%\control\print\monitors\%' and details like '%.dll') and  not ((process_path = 'c:\windows\system32\spoolsv.exe' and target_object like '%\control\print\monitors\cutepdf writer monitor v4.0\driver%' and details = 'cpwmon64_v40.dll' and (username like '%authori%' or username like '%autori%')) or target_object like '%\control\print\monitors\monvnc\driver%' or (target_object like '%control\print\environments\%' and target_object like '%\drivers\%' and target_object like '%\vnc printer%')))
